Fields.DialogueText: Kapitän, we've got Nixen approaching our stern. They're moving fast. What should we do?
Don't worry about it, Kapitän. I sensed them a while ago.
What do you mean by that, Nürnberg?
Let's just say they've got an explosive surprise ahead of them.

Fields.MenuText: I like the sound of that.
You're doing that half-cute, half-creepy smile again.
I'm going to need a bit more of an explanation.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought you might. Who doesn't love a nice surprise?
You think my smile's cute? It gets called creepy a lot, but never cute.
Just be patient, Kapitän. It'll be worth it.
Kapitän, they're getting closer.
Okay, Nürnberg, whatever you're planning better happen fast.
Wait for it...
How long am I supposed to be waiting?
Huh? It should've gone off. Why didn't it go boom?
Kapitän, we're in range of the Nixen. Your orders?
Sound the alarm! They're already too close for comfort.
Kapitän, I don't know what happened! That mine should've turned them to paste.
It's okay, Nürnberg. Accidents happen.
Not to me. Not when I'm making traps...
@BATTLE
What's that you're looking at, Nürnberg? Blueprints?
I'm trying to figure out why that mine didn't go off. According to this, everything should've been perfect.

Fields.MenuText: Aren't you fixating on this a little too much?
Mistakes happen to everyone. I'm sure you'll get it right next time.
Maybe it was the Morganas. Maybe they're wisening up to your tricks.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not fixating, I'm fixing. I can't keep going around making duds.
I get it right every time, though. This is the first time one of my mines didn't go boom.
I hope not. If that's the case then we've got bigger problems.
Gaaarrrgh! I just-- I need to figure this out, and I can't, and it's frustrating, and ugh!
Would an extra set of eyes help?
Huh? You mean like glasses?
I mean I could help with the next one. Hopefully, with the two of us working together, we'll be able to avoid another dud.
That doesn't... sound like the worst idea I've ever heard.
I'm looking forward to it already.
@BATTLE
Is that a new book, Nürnberg? It doesn't look like your Wanderbuch.
Oh, uh, it's not. I decided to start writing in a new book. In a way, it's like a sequel.
Mein Wanderbuch represents my past, and that's important to me, but I want to look to the future with a new light, a fresh slate, as it were.

Fields.MenuText: That sounds like a good idea to me.
So... we went through all that trouble for nothing?
What's this new book going to be called?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you agree, Kapitän.
No, of course not. Mein Wanderbuch will always have a special place in my heart. And on my bedside table. I'd have been devastated if I'd lost it for good.
That's a good question. I haven't even thought about that.
You know, honestly, I haven't gotten even one word out. I want this to be a journal of my travels and experiences, but I'm experiencing a bit of a block.
You've got a writer's block? Is there anyway I can help?
Hmmm... maybe, actually. I'm having a lot of trouble coming up with a good quote to start it off. Any ideas?
*ALARM*
How about "Damn Morganas!” We end up saying it a lot.
I'm not sure that's exactly what I'm looking for, Kapitän.
Well, I'll keep thinking about it. For now, let's get ready for battle.
@BATTLE
So... the medical officers still hate me.
Well, if it makes you feel better, I don't hate you.
It helps a little. It'd help more if I was getting more than grunts and glares out of them. Maybe I should give it some space.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe. They say time heals all wounds.
Or you could smother them until they love you. Some people like that.
Or you could just glare back until it gets awkward.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, I suppose I just have to be patient.
Is that what you like, Kapitän? I'll keep that in mind if I ever anger you.
Wouldn't that just make them angrier? I'm not sure, Kapitän.
You know, I could always talk to them, try and make them a little more amiable.
I appreciate that, but I started this, so I have to do this on my own.
I understand. And I know you recognize the value of good relations with the medical staff, so I'm sure I don't have to worry about my ship and crew tearing itself apart, right?
Is that a challenge to find more cooperative medics?
*ALARM*
Look, the last thing I want is to let these Morganas take us down.
Not even a possibility, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
All right, the Morganas have just noticed us... and now they're approaching.
I see it. Okay... the mine should be going off in three... two... one... zero...?
Negative one... negative two... negative three?
Dammit! How can it be a dud again? It has to be an issue with the components or something.
I don't know what went wrong. I was at your side every step of the way.
Maybe I'm just... losing my touch...

Fields.MenuText: No, that definitely isn't it. Not with that explosive personality of yours.
Maybe... It might be time to find a new hobby.
I... don't really know what to say. I'm just gonna pat you on the head.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh, now you're just trying to make me feel better.
I hear good things about knitting...
I don't know. It's a little embarrassing, but... it's kinda helping too.
You know what... no, I'm not going to let this stop me. I've got to figure this out.
That's what I like to hear. How about we get to port, resupply, and then we can try again. With fresh components this time.
Sounds perfect, Kapitän. Oh, but, uh, we did just lure those Nixen our way. We might want to take care of it.
Oh, right. I almost forgot. Let's hope they don't have too many friends.
@BATTLE
Finally, port. We were gone for too long, Kapitän. The sea is nice and all, but I was starting to miss the countryside.

Fields.MenuText: Really? I'd take the ocean over the land any day of the week.
Yeah, I need good solid ground every once in a while.
It wasn't that long. You lightweight.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I like the ocean too, but Deutschland is more my home. The land and the people are far more important to me.
You're right - it doesn't get any more solid than Deutschland. We've got the sturdiest ground you'll find in the world.
I suppose I'm just too attached to Deutschland, then. Because I feel like it's been forever.
You really love Germany, don't you, Nürnberg? I admire that about you.
Save the admiration for after I make an explosion that actually explodes.
Well, that's why we're here, isn't it? Let's pick up the materials we need and get to work on our next mine.
Oh, they're ours now?
Well, I'm helping, aren't I?
I'm not so sure... I mean, the last one you helped with wasn't exactly a success.
It'll be different this time. You'll see.
Let's hope so.
A little ways to go... but we've got a pack of Morganas in front of us. Battle stations, Nürnberg.
@BATTLE
This is more or less what we'll need to get to work on some more mines, right?
Well, you're the expert, right? Shouldn't you know exactly what we need?
Normally, yes. But... I don't know. With all these failures, I can't help but worry about every choice I make.
That's the last thing you should be doing, Nürnberg.
I know, I know. It's just one of those things that's easier to say than do.
Now, enough of that. Just tell me if you think we picked up enough or if I have to send for extra.

Fields.MenuText: Well, better safe than sorry.
I think we'll be fine, Nürnberg. I trust you.
Extra? Hell, let's just double up. How's that sound?

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah... I'd hate to be the only reason for our next resupply.
Really? Well, thanks, Kapitän. I hope I don't disappoint.
It sounds like a lot explosive materials. Even for me.
Okay, you know what? I'm just going to do it. A little extra couldn't hurt.
Sure. I just hate to see you doubting yourself like this.
Well, can you blame me? I've just been a dud factory lately!
*ALARM*
Well, you've still been handling Morganas just fine.
Yeah, but that's about all I can do.
@BATTLE
Kapitän, you received a letter. It's marked urgent.
Does it say who it's from?
Um... from... Urgent? That's all it says.
Well, that's very unhelpful.
I'm sorry, Kapitän. Here. I'm, uh, sorry again for the interruption.
It's no problem. Thank you, you're excused.
Let's see here... Oh, it's from the Admiral.
Kapitän, you ready to-- Oh, what's that?

Fields.MenuText: See? This would be the perfect moment for a Morgana to attack.
It's paper, Nürnberg. What does it look like?
It's our next assignment. Apparently the Admiral has some pretty high hopes for us.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I wouldn't hold your breath. What's in the letter?
Yes, but what's on the paper?
High hopes? What do you mean?
*ALARM*
Of course the Morganas attack now.
We'll take care of these beasts quickly. I want to hear about our new assignment.
I'm not so sure you will...
@BATTLE
It's from the Admiral. He's given us our next assignment.
A letter from the Admiral. We have our next assignment.
So, Kapitän. What's our next adventure, hmmm?
Well, it was a long letter, but the gist of it was that one of our allies needs our aid.
Okay, but our aid with what?
They've been fending off Morgana attacks for sometime now. Apparently the Admiral thinks we'd be perfect to fight off the Morganas for good.
Okay, I can get behind this. Blowing up a bunch of Morganas. It should be exciting.
We also have to deal with maintaining a good relation with these allies. German history with them is... rocky to say the least.
Oh, it's one of those "allies” who still hold grudges.
Yeah, your enemies from yesterday are your allies today. Will this be an issue for you?
Why would it be an issue for me?

Fields.MenuText: Well, I mean... you're still at odds with the medical staff.
Oh, no reason. My mistake. Forget I said anything.
You're very patriotic. They might feel offended by it.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm working on it! It's getting better and better every day.
Don't say something and then try to weasel out of it, Kapitän.
They have a country too, presumably.
Look, I'll be fine. I understand we'd get a lot worse than the cold shoulder if we get on their bad side.
I have faith in you. I know you can handle this.
I will keep this in mind, Kapitän. Thank you.
@BATTLE
Okay, and then we fill this powder... Before we weigh it down with these, but not too much...

Fields.MenuText: You know, you're really cute when you're concentrating.
You've got a smudge right on your nose there.
You're kind of amazing at this, you know, Nürnberg.

Fields.DialogueText: What? Cute?! Shut up, Kapitän, I'm working here.
What? Oh, I must've gotten some of the powder on me.
Heh, thanks. It's just one of those things I've always been a natural at.
You make building bombs fun. Well, more fun than usual. I'm enjoying your company with this activity.
Oh, uh, Nürnberg, doesn't that go there?
Oh! You're right. How could I have made such a stupid mistake.
Well, we caught it, so no harm done.
Right... no harm done... This time...
Did you say something?
No, just, uh, could you pass me that rag over there?
Sure thing.
@BATTLE
Here, let me get it off for you.
Kapitän! Hahaha... Stop, I can do it myself.
You know, I really enjoy spending this time with you. It's nice.
*ALARM*
Careful... let's clean this up as fast as we can before we run off...
Ja...
All right, looks like we're ready to head out, Kapitän. We should have everything we need.
Just in time, too. If it had taken us any longer, I'm afraid we wouldn't have made it in time.
I want to say I could think of worse things, but that wouldn't be right of me. Because then I think about how that means people are suffering.

Fields.MenuText: Look at you, putting yourself in other people's shoes.
Having trouble keeping an open mind there, Nürnberg?
Yes, congratulations. You realized that people suffering is a bad thing.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Kapitän. I like to think I'm doing better.
I'm just trying to think a little more before I act. Ruthlessness without recklessness.
That's not what I meant, Kapitän. I just... I don't know. I'm trying to be better here.
What I would *like* to do is to throw other variables to the wind and leave that port to burn. The Nixen would be trapped and a war target of the Reich's would be dealt with.
Wouldn't that reflect really terribly on the German contribution to the INPF?
If you failed to look at the bigger picture, I suppose it might.
Yeah, let's try and think up a plan with fewer potential casualties.
@BATTLE
*BOOM*
Yes, finally! The booms are back!
Now that was an explosion. Good job, Nürnberg.
Danke, Kapitän. You were a great help.
I'm glad to hear it. When should we get to work on the next one?
Actually... I've been thinking about that...

Fields.MenuText: And you're super excited for it?
Did I do something wrong?
Oh no, I don't like the sound of that.

Fields.DialogueText: Not quite...
Nein, you didn't do anything wrong. Of course you didn't.
I'm sorry if you're offended, Kapitän.
I just... I think that it's more of a solo activity.
Really? I thought we worked pretty well together.
We did. We do. It's just... I'm afraid you might be a little... distracting for me.
Distracting?
*ALARM*
Oh, great. I guess that explosion was a little too loud. We've got company now.
What does she mean by "distracting"?
@BATTLE
Kapitän, what smells delicious in here?

Fields.MenuText: I might've picked up a special treat for you.
Well... I just came from the bathroom. You weirdo.
Why, whatever do you mean?

Fields.DialogueText: A special treat? Care to elaborate?
That's not the smell I meant, and you know it.
Don't play coy with me, Kapitän. You're not a good actor.
Seriously, what do I want to devour in here?
I wanted to celebrate a job well done, so I picked you up a special treat back at port.
That's... is that Lebkuchen? How did you know I adore Lebkuchen?
You'd be surprised what you could find out on a ship this size with some investigating.
This is... I'm pretty sure this is the best surprise I've ever gotten. Danke schön, Kapitän.
Well, you've earned it. You got your explosive mojo back.
Well, then we earned it together. You deserve every bit of this Lebkuchen as I do.
I thought I was just distracting you.
In a good way.
*ALARM*
Damn. It looks like we'll have to take a few of these for the road. We've got Nixen to destroy.
Don't we always?
@BATTLE
Nürnberg, were you just having an actual conversation with one of the Medical Officers?
Ja, he was actually thanking me for my work in their storerooms. He said that it took a little time for him to get used to it, but now he sees what I was talking about.
Really? So you're okay with all of them now?
Eh, not really. He says that while it's more convenient, all the rest of the medical staff still kind of hates me. But at least I was right in the end.
Yes, but we know that the ends don't always justify the means now, right?
Jaja, scho recht. I'm just glad that they're really enjoying it, even if they're not enjoying me at the moment.

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry, they just need a little more time.
Yeah, and I thought I could hold a grudge.
Maybe we should just replace them with new people? That's one way to fix all this.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. You keep telling me that.
I suppose it falls to me to keep them motivated, if only for the crew's sake.
I know you're joking, Kapitän, but let's not discard that plan right away.
*ALARM*
We've got company.
Well, let's take them on. I'm in a good mood now.
@BATTLE
That's our destination.
And I assume those are the Nixen we were sent here to deal with?

Fields.MenuText: Probably.
You sure?
No. I don't think so.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, what are we waiting for? Let's rush in and save the day.
I'm pretty sure. They're attacking the port after all.
Really? So you think it's just a coincidence that they're attacking the harbor?
Okay, let's hurry to the battle. Oh, but Nürnberg, be careful where you aim. We don't need to give our allies anymore reason to hate us.
I'll make sure my shots only land on the Nixen.
Actually this is a good opportunity for us, Kapitän. We can prove to them that we're here to help. It might be a good thing that the Nixen are attacking right now.
See, that's one of those things that I wouldn't repeat to them during our meetings.
Ah, got it.
@BATTLE
Nürnberg, are you ready to meet with our allies and discuss our battle plans?
Oh, um... Ja, sure. Just give me a second.
What are you messing with over there?
My battle plans. It's how I think we should proceed.
I'm not sure I understand it, but it looks good to me.
Well, we'll see what everyone else thinks about it. In any event, we should listen to them. They know their port best and they might spill some interesting intel.

Fields.MenuText: I've got faith in you. You can do this.
Dutiful as ever. Just remember who you work for.
Hmmm, see? You really are changing.

Fields.DialogueText: I think so too. Let's get to that meeting.
I haven't forgotten.
It's harder than it looks, but I'm trying.
*ALARM*
I thought we chased off all the Morganas.
Apparently there were a few stragglers. Shouldn't take us too long to take care of them.
Let's hope you're right.
@BATTLE
So that's how we plan to handle the next raid now that we have your help. Any questions?
No, it all makes sense to me. Nürnberg?
Mhmmmm.
Your Aloja has been fairly quiet this whole time. Is something wrong?

Fields.MenuText: No, she's just always like that.
I think she might be coming down with a cold or something.
You can ask her yourself. She can answer on her own.

Fields.DialogueText: I see. Well, you know la Aloja better than I do.
Las Alojas get sick? Interesting. I never thought about that.
Of course. I meant no offense to la Aloja.
Okay, I must say one thing. I can't hold it in anymore!
Please, speak freely, Nürnberg.
It's stupid to just sit on our hands and wait for them to attack again.
You want us to go after them ourselves? We don't have the numbers for that kind of operations.
Nein, I'm suggesting we leave some surprises in the water for the Nixen.
Ah, traps.
*ALARM*
Another raid already?
No, this is more likely a scouting party. They pop in every once in a while to test our defenses.
Well, let's make sure we pass this test.
And then afterwards we can talk more about these traps of yours.
@BATTLE
So we fill the barrels with explosives and pitch or oil and then place them around the perimeter.
So not only will we be alerted to their approach, but they'll also take a good hit when they cross that line.
Not only that, but the oil should catch fire on the water and keep the Nixen from rushing forward.

Fields.MenuText: Impressive.
You sure it'll work?
Sounds destructive. I like it.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you. I put a good deal of thought into it.
It should. If it doesn't, I'll cut off my own hand and eat it.
I like that glint in your eyes, Kapitän. Reminds me of myself when I'm all excited.
There is one problem I have with this plan.
Was?
That oil would make more of a mess than its worth. It'd take a lot of time and manpower to clean up after this is all over and done with.
This is war. We have to make some sacrifices.
I understand that, it's just--
If you're worried about the oil, stop worrying. It will burn out eventually and save us a cleanup.
And we're supposed to live with a five-day oil fire? You want to smoke us out in the process?
Also gut, I see your point. Then we'll use just enough oil to stick the Nixen with burning patches. We'll add more explosives and shrapnel or something instead.
You're doing good, Nürnberg. You're doing just fine.
If you say so... So how does that plan sound to everyone? Good?
Well, it means more damage to the Brujas and less damage to us. So it works for me.
Great, now let's get to work. We'll run a patrol to get any Morganas out of our hair before we start laying out the mines.
We should have plenty of time to lay them all out. The next raid is still a ways off.
Still, no point in procrastinating. Let's go, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
Please don't. I like your hands where they are.
Well, alright, but that's how sure I am.
Excellent work, Nürnberg. I guess it was a good thing we picked up that extra material for the mines, after all.
Ja. Let's just hope these all go off. And that they're all placed before the next attack.
Are we behind schedule?
Nein, but... my original plan would've taken less time to prepare. I could've placed all those mines by myself in under a day.
Having regrets?
Would you be disappointed in me if I was?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe a little, but I'd certainly still be proud of the actions you're taking.
I could never be disappointed in you, Nürnberg.
Probably, but not for long. I mean not with that cute face of yours.

Fields.DialogueText: That's a good point. Actions speak louder than words, right?
Well, don't say that. I just might start testing that theory.
Hehehe, stop it, I'm being serious, Kapitän. Don't make me smile.
Look, just know that you've impressed me. You did great with our allies.
Well, I guess if I impressed you then I must be doing something right.
You're doing plenty right. I'm very proud of you, Nürnberg. You realize we're helping mend the tension between nations, right?
*BOOM*
What was that?!
It's what I was afraid of. The raid is coming now!
I thought we had a few days left!
Don't look at me. It wasn't my information. I was just responsible for the mines.
Well, you clearly did your job well.
Not well enough. Most of them weren't in position yet. We're going to have to fend them off ourselves.
Sounds fun. Let's show our allies how to handle some Morganas.
@BATTLE
@BATTLE
How are we doing?
We took some hits, but our allies are a lot worse off than us.
You're right. It looks like a few ships went down with the Morganas.
We should hurry to rescue any survivors.
You're right, we definitely should.
What's with that smile, Kapitän? People are shipwrecked.
I'm just proud of you. The old you would've wanted to run after the Morganas and make sure they were destroyed while they were weakened.
That doesn't sound too far off. Was I really that bad, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: It's all in the past now, Nürnberg. No need to dwell on it.
I wouldn't say bad. I found it cute.
Sometimes. But you've always had the best intentions.

Fields.DialogueText: Mhmmmm, we can't change the past. Only the future.
You found it cute? Well, maybe I shouldn't change then.
I'm glad you could tell. I just want what's best for my ship.
*BOOM*
Was that a mine?
Oh, great. It looks like someone else decided it'd be a good idea to chase after the Nixen. They're sinking now.
You did place a whole lot of mines. It's a good thing we're here to help them.
Oh, don't worry, I still find you plenty adorable.
Another pack of Morganas headed this way. Let's take them down!
And that's the last of them, Kapitän. All the mines are floating in the water.
You're fast as ever, Nürnberg. Excellent work.
Well, seeing where the Nixen attacked from made it a little easier. I guess that was a bit of a bright side.

Fields.MenuText: That's a good point, Nürnberg.
Yeah, I'm not sure all the damage they dealt was worth it.
You're asking for trouble, Nürnberg. With that kind of talk I wouldn't be surprised if they attacked again in a few seconds.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly. I'm trying to be positive.
Well, I'm not saying that. I'm just trying to make the best of it, Kapitän.
They can feel free. They'd be welcomed by a wall of explosions.
We should run a patrol just to make sure some wandering ships don't set off your traps.
Or wandering Nixen. As much as they deserve to blow up, we need to save the surprise for the raiding party.
Exactly. Let's go.
@BATTLE
We will be in range before long, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
Nürnberg, you're not going to believe what they just asked us to do. They want us to leave a hole in our defenses to continue trade.
What? That's ridiculous. Can't they just wait until this is all over? I'm sure they'll survive.
Apparently they're worried about this going on for too long. They're more worried about trade relations than making it through these attacks in one piece.
How stupid can they... Nein, nein, nein, wait... We ought to respect their wishes. They're our allies. If they want to die that badly, we shouldn't stop them.

Fields.MenuText: I know you want to be more diplomatic, but that doesn't mean you have to consider every dumb suggestion.
Okay... Let's try and see things their way. In a more... charitable way.
Nah, it's too stupid. Let's ignore them.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not committing to a specific course of action. I'm just saying we should think about it.
It is quite trying... but I hope you can appreciate that I am trying to improve myself, Kapitän.
Kapitän, it sounds like I'm not the only one that needs to be more diplomatic.
Well, is there any way to create an opening in our perimeter without leaving a big hole for the Morganas?
We couldn't move the mines even if we wanted to. They're sensitive.
Wait, how did we get through to run our patrols, then? We didn't blow up.
Well, I know where all the mines are. I know how to weave between them. Any other ship would sail blindly into a wall of explosions.
I think I know how we can compromise.
Oh? Please share, because I'm not eager to leave a hole in our defenses.
We can agree to just escort any incoming and outgoing ships past the perimeter. It means a little more work for us, but I think it'll keep everyone happy.
That... could work. We could handle that.
Good. Look at you, being all diplomatic.
It's only because you're here to hold my hand through it all.
Well, I'm not going anywhere. And by the way, my hands are on the ends of my arms if you ever need them.
Another wave of 'em. All hands to battle stations!
Interesting... what sort of offer is that, Kapitän?
Nürnberg, things are kicking off.
You haven't seen anything yet, Kapitän.
What are you talking about? Your mines have been set off. We should hurry to intercept the rest of them before they get too close to port.
Not so fast. Just wait and watch!

Fields.MenuText: There's no time to waste!
There's that smile again. I could just stare at it all day.
You want to just sit and wait? That's new.

Fields.DialogueText: We're not wasting anytime. Just trust me, Kapitän.
Hey, don't stare at me! Stare at the Nixen!
You'll understand in... drei... zwei... eins...
*BOOM*
Another round of explosions?
Weighted mines. Triggered to come up after the first set. I was curious to see if they'd work as designed.
You are scary sometimes, Nürnberg. I like it.
What? That... that would be the first time I've heard that.
Hey, don't get all flustered now! We've got Morganas to deal with!
@BATTLE
There's more? They didn't seem this strong before.
They probably weren't sending their best before. Now they have to. Their worst is nothing more than refuse thanks to us.

Fields.MenuText: I hope we can handle this...
I'm guessing you have some more tricks up your sleeves for these guys?
Sounds like a good thing. This will be the end of them now for sure.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, don't give up so soon, Kapitän. Have some faith in us.
Hehe, you know me too well, Captain.
My thoughts exactly. Let's obliterate them, Kapitän!
You know, when I turn and see that creepy, cute smile of yours, Nürnberg, I just get filled with an awful lot of confidence.
Then don't look away. Feel free to stare all you like...
Are you turning red?
Can you blame me? You keep staring at me while we've got Nixen to fight!
@BATTLE
I don't stare... but whenever I look, I usually see you looking back.
Perhaps I do, but it still does not disprove that-- Ughhhh! Forget it!
Are you still looking at me? I hope you are.
Just for a moment. Enemy contacts are closing fast, so we should probably...
Ja, probably we should... fight them.
Nürnberg, what are you doing in here? We did it - you should be out here celebrating with the rest of us.
I'll be out in a minute. I'm just writing down everything I don't want to forget about this mission of ours.
Look at that, you're writing up a storm there. Can I get a little preview?
Hey! Don't try and sneak a peek, Kapitän! This is private.
Oh, come on, I already read the entirety of your last Wanderbuch. Why can't I read this one?
Well... that was different. You're in this one.

Fields.MenuText: Oh! Only good things, I hope.
Oh, I see. You're bad-mouthing your captain in there. Makes sense why you wouldn't want me to see it, then.
You mean I wasn't in the last one? Huh, I could've sworn I was.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I think it's good...
I'm not writing anything bad... I'm just... it's embarrassing alright?!
Of course you weren't in the last one. I didn't know you while I was writing it.
All right, I think that's a good place to finish for now.
Ready to join the party, then?
Actually, I wanted to talk to you while I had you alone.
Sure, what's up, Nürnberg?
I think you're an amazing person.
Well, thanks. You're, uh, you're making me blush here, Nürnberg.
You've been a really great friend to me. Above and beyond what an ordinary Kapitän would do.
I know I have my issues, but you don't judge me for them. In fact, you like me more for them.
Whatever issues you may or may not have, you're still a wonderful person, Nürnberg. Never forget that.
Stop saying such sweet stuff like that. This is already embarrassing enough.
What's so embarrassing?
I... I like you, okay? Like, more than a Kapitän. More than a friend.
Well, that's good to hear, because I feel the same way about you.
Was?! Really?
Yeah. I thought I was being pretty obvious about it, too.
N-not obvious enough. You didn't say anything.
Well, now we've both said something. So let's get to the party. We've got one more reason to celebrate now.
They keep coming!
Then we keep fighting. One more push should do it, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
Stay with me here just a little bit longer, Kapitän, so we can have a moment alone. Then after, I promise we will go.
I like that idea...
